April 12, 1954
Mr. G. H. Griffiths
Fund For Adult Education
1444 Wentworth Avenue
Pasadena 5, California
Dear Bills
Thanks for your letter of April 8
about NAE8 placement service. I had a note
a week or so ago from Skornia, and one of
his people, and of course was delighted to
learn they were going to be set for opera-
tions soon. I suggested that they have their
man come down here some time after May 1, or
whenever convenient for them, so that we can
give them whatever we have that they need.
Actually, 1 believe there has been some ex¬
change of names, etc. between Skornia and
our Mrs. Kelly in the past so, as far as I
know, no great problems loom ahead.
I feel it will be important to set
up some regular system for referral of in¬
quiries, fo1 low-through, etc., but no doubt
the people working at the particular tasks
can come up with a proper routine.
Cordial ly.
cc Harry Skornia
Robert R. Mullen
Executive Director
